introTxt.about: Purdue MIND’s purpose is to promote and grow the biomedical engineering community at Purdue by providing undergraduate students the opportunity to engage in hands-on activities, discuss current research, and network with a wide range of faculty both within and outside of Purdue including professors, physicians, and engineers. We are a unique, multidisciplinary student organization that seeks to innovate and develop medical technology. Our overall goals are listed below:
introTxt.goal1: To give Purdue undergraduates extensive experience with medical technology market research, design, prototyping, validation, regulatory approval, intellectual property management, and transition to market.
introTxt.goal2: To allow highly motivated students to network with each other and with professors and medical professionals and to collaborate on a significant, long-term, medically-focused project.
introTxt.goal3: To recognize the work done on the project through submission to national design competitions.

officers.name: Simon Hasik
officers.minor: Minor in Electrical and Computer Engineering

officers.name: Sam Ying
officers.description: I have been a part of MIND since freshman year and I enjoy working on the various biomedical projects with other members. MIND has helped me grow both technically and professionally and I am grateful to have had the opportunity to be part of this club. As an officer, I hope to reach out to more Purdue students and give them a chance to work on cool projects with MIND.

officers.name: Dalton Aaker
officers.description: In my previous experience in mind I have become the secretary and learned how to load a group of intelligent individuals to a common goal. I have also learned how to handle meeting notes and keeping advisors updated. In my new position as director of entrepreneurship and ideation, I would like to be able to learn how to lead the group in competition submissions and outreach.

officers.name: Matt Ghera
officers.description: I’ve found MIND to be a very welcoming and helpful community of people wanting to get hands on experience with research and production. It’s casual enough to be very approachable and easy to fit into my schedule while also being something I look forward to each week. Especially being outside of the biomedical major, I mainly hope to bring my manufacturing knowledge and enable others to be more ambitious with their projects and improve everyone else’s club experience.

officers.name: Aditi
officers.description: I love MIND because I get to spend my time with peers who are passionate about what they do. MIND allows me try out a variety of roles and collaboratively perform applied engineering to make an impact. As Director of Networking and Events, I hope to expand our social media following-base, improve alumni relations, and establish a professional development series.
